questions.question: Following the Israeli strike in Doha reported on 9 September 2025, Australian outlets said at least five people were killed. Which of the following was reported among the casualties?
questions.explanation: Australian reporting (e.g., news.com.au) and international wire services cited by Australian outlets identified a Qatari security official among those killed in the Doha strike; the other listed options were not reported among the casualties.

questions.question: In the recent Australia–Türkiye standoff over who will host COP31, which city has Australia centred its hosting bid on?
questions.explanation: Australian reporting (including ABC News) states that Australia's bid to host COP31 is centred on Adelaide — with the Adelaide Convention Centre identified as the main venue and the bid promoted with a Pacific focus — while Türkiye has a rival bid.

questions.question: Do you want me to run a live search of Australian mainstream news outlets now (as of 10 Sep 2025 AEST) and pick a Melbourne/Victoria story published in the past 48 hours (since 8 Sep 2025 00:00 AEST) to base the quiz question on?

answers.text: Yes — run the live search and pick a Melbourne/Victoria story (from mainstream outlets such as ABC, The Age, The Guardian Australia, 9News, Herald Sun)
No — use a story I will paste instead (it must be from a mainstream Australian outlet and published since 8 Sep 2025 00:00 AEST)
No — pick any recent national Australian story (not limited to Victoria/Melbourne)
Not now — I'll come back later

questions.explanation: To guarantee the quiz is based on a verifiable mainstream Melbourne/Victoria story published within the required 48‑hour window, the assistant must run a live search now. Option 2 could be acceptable only if you actually paste an article that meets the outlet and timeframe requirements; option 3 does not satisfy the explicit Victoria/Melbourne requirement; option 4 defers the task.

questions.question: In the Supreme Court of Victoria's recent ruling in the concussion group proceeding brought by former Geelong player Max Rooke, what did the court decide?

answers.text: Granted the AFL's application to break up the case so former players must sue individually
Refused the AFL's bid to de‑class the case and allowed the group proceeding to continue
Dismissed Rooke's lawsuit against the AFL without a trial
Entered summary judgment in favour of the AFL, ending the litigation

questions.explanation: The Supreme Court of Victoria rejected the AFL's application to 'de‑class' or break up the concussion claims, so the class/group proceeding led by Max Rooke will continue. Media reports note the court allowed the group proceeding to proceed (with the initial trial limited to Rooke's playing years).

questions.question: According to recent Australian coverage, which US singer did the NRL announce as the pre‑game/headline performer for the 2025 NRL Grand Final — an announcement Peter V’landys used to contrast the AFL’s booking of Snoop Dogg?
questions.explanation: Australian coverage (news.com.au) reports the NRL has locked in US singer Teddy Swims as the pre‑game/headline performer for the 2025 NRL Grand Final, and that NRL chairman Peter V’landys used the announcement to take a swipe at the AFL’s booking of Snoop Dogg. The other listed artists were not reported as the NRL’s booking.
